captions.text: Anything you can think of, we've tried it.
We lost three guys with that one.

Well then have you at least tried
climbing out of here? course we tried it
The vines don't go all the way to the top.

But even if they didn't, couldn't you
at least built a ladder or scaffolding or something?
Alright even if you could get all the way to the top so what? Then what would you do?

Uh.. then I build bridges across or
something and climb out in this mess.
I can't believe in three years we never tried this!
That maze cost like a bazillion dollars!
I told you we should've put a dome over that thing!
Now I can't even fake my own death for no reason!
Where did all this sand come from?
wishing I could sting some kids...

comments.author: alejandro rauscher

comments.text:
Even if you get on top of it and try to build a bridge over it, those big 
stones shift all the time and wouldnt allow a good place to anchor to. Plus 
the grievers could probably climb up and get you anyway. Plus the 
scientists could see whats going on and open all the doors overnight. And 
even if the ladder and bridge idea works, past the tight maze area it gets 
a bit more open with those tall turning blade walls. Digging would take 
absolutely forever and its possible that the whole thing is on top of a 
concrete slab.﻿
